programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's sharing her love of Middle Eastern family feasts with Israeli chef, Eran Tibi. Dishing up an Israeli mezze of Stuffed Brick and Sweet Potato Hummus for breakfast, an incredible Mussakhan for lunch, Eran's Aubergine, Tomato and Beef Stew for dinner and Nadia's sensational Cigar Baklava with Cheat's Pistachio Ice Cream for dessert.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry and Ian start this week’s show with their spin on British Classic and knock up a tasty Vegan ‘Fish’ Pie. Next, they bring a taste of Mexico to the kitchen with Chilli and Nachos, the perfect snack for a night in. Rachel Ama joins Henry and Ian and cook them her Harissa Hotpot, gorgeous aubergine cooked in a hot and spicy sauce, topped with herbs, pistaochios and avocado. Henry and Ian then create a showstopper to impress all your family and friends, a Burrito Cake, filled with all kinds of goodies: sweet potatoes, smoky peppers and spicy rice. The show is rounded off with their decadent New York Style Cheesecake topped with strawberries.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Join Ainsley in his kitchen where he is cooking up some relaxing and comforting food for those Lazy Sundays! On the menu for his Sunday brunch best are Sweetcorn Fritters with Avocado, Tomato & Black Bean Salsa & Poached Egg. Gyles Brandreth makes an appearance in his kitchen—showing Ainsley his take on the Fish Finger Sandwich. BOSH! are in their kitchen, showing Ainsley take on quick Custard Tarts for that Sunday sweet fix. And Ainsley indulges in a brunch cocktail favourite—his Bloody Mary with Polenta Mozzarella Sticks and finishing off the Sunday menu with his Rosemary & Anchovy Slow Roasted Lamb with Roasted Roots.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: The show starts off the show with a taste of Spain as the boys cook up Henry’s Dad’s Paella. For the sweet toothed amongst us Henry and Ian bake the nations favourite cake, the afternoon tea classic; Victoria Sponge. Day Radley, head chef at the Vegan Chef School treats the boys to her colourful Beetroot Ravioli and slaw. Henry and Ian’s Snack Hacks focus on how to jazz up homemade hummus, making it even more tasty! The guys finish off with a cowboy influenced pizza serving up Texan-style pizza - with smoky, spiced tofu and tasty Bourbon sauce.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Get ready for today's cocoa-rich episode with Kirsten's ultimate chocolate cupcakes and chocolate covered toffee apples. Kirsten also shows us how to create her delicate white chocolate and passionfruit flowers and she reveals her secret to combining cocktails and chocolate.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Immerse yourself in a chocolate haven with Kirsten's show-stopping recipes, like her marvelous mousse & mocha cheesecake, her simple but spectacular orange biscotti or her sesame-infused chocolate twigs.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Making rustic Italian recipes from a renowned restaurant cookbook, Anna and Kristina try to impress two Brooklyn chefs who take their meatballs very seriously.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Cooking bold Southwestern flavours from this celebrity cookbook isn't as sunny as Anna and Kristina had hoped.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Sussex, business partners Will and Jack are kicking off the week with some decidedly risky fare from their restaurant MED. Head chef Will doesn't like to waste any part of the animal when it comes to his food so is including the hearts of the duck for his BBQ duck main. - Before they can even get to the main, head chef Amy from from Ami Bistro runs in to trouble with the trout tartare starter. Raw fish is just not her thing but her front of house guy, Ryan, is more than impressed by Will's luxurious beard.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's sharing her love of Middle Eastern family feasts with Israeli chef, Eran Tibi. Dishing up an Israeli mezze of Stuffed Brick and Sweet Potato Hummus for breakfast, an incredible Mussakhan for lunch, Eran's Aubergine, Tomato and Beef Stew for dinner and Nadia's sensational Cigar Baklava with Cheat's Pistachio Ice Cream for dessert.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Cooking bold Southwestern flavours from this celebrity cookbook isn't as sunny as Anna and Kristina had hoped.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Sussex, business partners Will and Jack are kicking off the week with some decidedly risky fare from their restaurant MED. Head chef Will doesn't like to waste any part of the animal when it comes to his food so is including the hearts of the duck for his BBQ duck main. - Before they can even get to the main, head chef Amy from from Ami Bistro runs in to trouble with the trout tartare starter. Raw fish is just not her thing but her front of house guy, Ryan, is more than impressed by Will's luxurious beard.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's sharing her love of Middle Eastern family feasts with Israeli chef, Eran Tibi. Dishing up an Israeli mezze of Stuffed Brick and Sweet Potato Hummus for breakfast, an incredible Mussakhan for lunch, Eran's Aubergine, Tomato and Beef Stew for dinner and Nadia's sensational Cigar Baklava with Cheat's Pistachio Ice Cream for dessert.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry and Ian kick this week’s Living On The Veg with crispy Party Poppers and a BBQ dipping sauce, the perfect snack to share whilst watching a movie. Then they show us the e prefect way to start the day with their protein packed Breakfast Burrito and Green Goddess Smoothie. Bake Off’s Prue Leith joins the boys in the kitchen and they hope to impress her with their Mushroom Wellington ideal centrepiece for dinner parties. Henry and Ian then take inspiration from Japan and cook up a delicious Aubergine Katsu Curry. They finish the show with sweet treat with a twist…Banana Bread Doughnuts!

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Jenn visits a First Nations community that has brought bison back to their traditional lands and a family focused on regenerative agriculture.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Mined in Saskatchewan, salt is vital in the kitchen. Jenn learns how the 'magic' ingredient can accentuate and elevate a dish.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Join Ainsley in his kitchen whilst he explores some dishes perfect for dining al fresco. First up is “cypriot lamb chops,” “cherry tomato skewers,” and “potato salad,” ideal for your next BBQ. Supper Club host, Joseph Denison Carey serves up some tantalising tagliatelle sure to whisk you away to Italy. Ainsley shows Radio DJ and foodie Dev Griffin how to make “sesame and ginger seabass” with an “asian noodle salad.” Olly Smith has drinks perfect for the great outdoors, all in cans. And for his last dish, Ainsley has the perfect picnic dessert, “strawberry hobnob cheesecake jars,” portable and delicious!

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: Karena and Kasey land in the food mecca of Tokyo and find them selves being auctioned off for a charity. - In the city that boasts the most michelin stars in the world, the Maketu sisters start tasting some serious dishes, from the best Ramen in Japan to a 20-course kaiseki lunch and michelin star sushi. - But it’s their final night that sees them pushed to their limits as they’re in a working kitchen feeding hungry guests who won their services in the ‘Support our Kids’ charity auction.

programme.title: Karena & Kasey's Foreign Flavours
programme.desc: In their final destination, Karena and Kasey are in the Pacific visiting New Zealand’s closest neighbour, New Caledonia. - It’s a perfect foodie fusion between Pacific island produce and French cooking techniques. Where else can you eat pastries, baguettes, snails, and cheese under palm trees by crystal clear waters. - One of the sisters gets an exclusive lesson with one of the island's top chefs, while the other heads to the beautiful Isle des Pins. - After learning all about sustainability of the ocean, Karena and Kasey hope to impress a group of savvy New Caledonian foodies.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: It's grace under pressure as the home cooks attempt to wow a star-studded - wall of chefs.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: A home cook tries to rewrite the rules of mixing seafood and dairy in the Crowd-Pleaser round, and everyone tries to make magic out of the romano beans in Chef Susur Lee’s fridge.
